pullRequest.body:
The definition of `PowerSeries.invOneSubPow` has been changed into the following:
Given a commutative ring `S` and a number `d : â„•`, `PowerSeries.invOneSubPow S d` is the multiplicative inverse of `(1 - X) ^ d` in `SâŸ¦XâŸ§Ë£`. When `d` is `0`, `PowerSeries.invOneSubPow S d` will just be `1`. When `d` is positive, `PowerSeries.invOneSubPow S d` will be `âˆ‘ n, Nat.choose (d - 1 + n) (d - 1)`.

bors merge

Is there a reason not to use
```suggestion
theorem invOneSubPow_zero_val_eq_one : (invOneSubPow S 0).val = 1 := by
```
?

```suggestion
  rw [â† Nat.sub_one_add_one_eq_of_pos h, invOneSubPow, add_tsub_cancel_right]
```

More readable as
```suggestion
    invOneSubPow S d =
      (Units.mkOfMulEqOne (1 - X) (mk 1 : SâŸ¦XâŸ§) <|
        Eq.trans (mul_comm _ _) (mk_one_mul_one_sub_eq_one S))â»Â¹ ^ d := by
```

Either
```suggestion
      refine (DivisionMonoid.inv_eq_of_mul _ (invOneSubPow S (d + 1)) ?_).symm
      rw [â† Units.val_eq_one, Units.val_mul, Units.val_pow_eq_pow_val]
      exact (invOneSubPow S (d + 1)).inv_val
```
or
```suggestion
      exact (DivisionMonoid.inv_eq_of_mul _ (invOneSubPow S (d + 1)) <| by
        rw [â† Units.val_eq_one, Units.val_mul, Units.val_pow_eq_pow_val]
        exact (invOneSubPow S (d + 1)).inv_val).symm
```

```suggestion
theorem invOneSubPow_zero : invOneSubPow S 0 = 1 := by
```
